P001812: na svato nāpi parato na dvābhyāṃ nāpy ahetutaḥ |utpannā jātu vidyante bhāvāḥ kva cana ke cana ||1||

P001815: No thing anywhere is ever born from itself, from something else, from both or without a cause.

P001812: catvāraḥ pratyayā hetur ārambaṇam anantaram |tathaivādhipateyaṃ ca pratyayo nāsti pañcamaḥ ||2||

P001815: There are four conditions: Causes, objects, immediate and dominant. There is no fifth.

P001812: na hi svabhāvo bhāvānāṃ pratyayādiṣu vidyate |avidyamāne svabhāve parabhāvo na vidyate ||3||
P001813: 因緣次第緣 緣緣增上緣四緣生諸法 更無第五緣2
P001815: The essence of things does not exist in conditions and so on. If an own thing does not exist, an other thing does not exist.

P001812: kriyā na pratyayavatī nāpratyayavatī kriyā |pratyayā nākriyāvantaḥ kriyāvantaś ca santy uta ||4||
P001813: 果為從緣生 為從非緣生是緣為有果 是緣為無果
P001815: There is no activity which has conditions. There is no activity which does not have conditions. There are no conditions which do not have activity, and none which do have activity.

P001812: utpadyate pratītyemān itīme pratyayāḥ kila |yāvan notpadyata ime tāvan nāpratyayāḥ katham ||5||
P001813: 因是法生果 是法名為緣若是果未生 何不名非緣
P001815: Since something is born in dependence upon them, then they are known as “conditions”. As long as it is not born, why are they not non-conditions?

P001812: naivāsato naiva sataḥ pratyayo ’rthasya yujyate |asataḥ pratyayaḥ kasya sataś ca pratyayena kim ||6||
P001813: 果先於緣中 有無俱不可先無為誰緣 先有何用緣
P001815: It is impossible for something that either exists or not to have conditions. If it were non-existent, of what would they be the conditions? If it were existent, why would it need conditions?

P001812: na san nāsan na sad asan dharmo nirvartate yadā |kathaṃ nirvartako hetur evaṃ sati hi yujyate ||7||

P001815: When things cannot be established as either existent, non-existent or both, how can one speak of an “establishing cause.” Such would be impossible.

P001812: anārambaṇa evāyaṃ san dharma upadiśyate |athānārambaṇe dharme kuta ārambaṇaṃ punaḥ ||8||
P001813: 果若未生時 則不應有滅滅法何能緣 故無次第緣3
P001815: An existent phenomenon is clearly said to have no object at all. If the phenomenon has no object, where can the object exist?

P001812: anutpanneṣu dharmeṣu nirodho nopapadyate |nānantaram ato yuktaṃ niruddhe pratyayaś ca kaḥ ||9||
P001813: 如諸佛所說 真實微妙法於此無緣法 云何有緣緣4
P001815: If phenomena are not born, it is invalid for there to be cessation. Therefore, an immediate condition is unreasonable. What, having ceased, can also be a condition?

P001812: bhāvānāṃ niḥsvabhāvānāṃ na sattā vidyate yataḥ |satīdam asmin bhavatīty etan naivopapadyate ||10||
P001813: 諸法無自性 故無有有相說有是事故 是事有不然
P001815: Because the existence of essence-less things does not exist, it is incorrect to say:“When this exists, that arises.”

P001812: na ca vyastasamasteṣu pratyayeṣv asti tat phalam |pratyayebhyaḥ kathaṃ tac ca bhaven na pratyayeṣu yat ||11||
P001813: 略廣因緣中 求果不可得因緣中若無 云何從緣出
P001815: There is no effect at all in the conditions individually or together. How can that which is not in the conditions itself be born from conditions?

P001812: athāsad api tat tebhyaḥ pratyayebhyaḥ pravartate |apratyayebhyo ’pi kasmān nābhipravartate phalam ||12||
P001813: 若謂緣無果 而從緣中出是果何不從 非緣中而出
P001815: If, although the effect is not there, it is born from those conditions, why is an effect not born from what are not its conditions?

P001812: phalaṃ ca pratyayamayaṃ pratyayāś cāsvayaṃmayāḥ |phalam asvamayebhyo yat tat pratyayamayaṃ katham ||13||
P001813: 若果從緣生 是緣無自性從無自性生 何得從緣生
P001815: Effects are of the nature of conditions. Conditions do not have own nature. How can those effects of what does not have own nature be of the nature of conditions?

P001812: tasmān na pratyayamayaṃ nāpratyayamayaṃ phalam |saṃvidyate phala_bhāvāt pratyayāpratyayāḥ kutaḥ ||14||
P001813: 果不從緣生 不從非緣生以果無有故 緣非緣亦無
P001815: Therefore, it does not have the nature of conditions, nor is there an effect with the nature of non-conditions. Since there is no effect, what could be its non-conditions or conditions?

P001812: gataṃ na gamyate tāvad agataṃ naiva gamyate |gatāgatavinirmuktaṃ gamyamānaṃ na gamyate ||1||
P001813: 已去無有去 未去亦無去離已去未去 去時亦無去
P001815: Then there is no going in what has gone; there is no going also in what has not yet gone. Motion is unknowable apart from what has gone and not yet gone.

P001812: ceṣṭā yatra gatis tatra gamyamāne ca sā yataḥ |na gate nāgate ceṣṭā gamyamāne gatis tataḥ ||2||
P001813: 動處則有去 此中有去時非已去未去 是故去時去
P001815: Where there is moving, there there is going. Furthermore, because moving is within motion -- and is neither gone nor not yet gone, therefore, there is going within motion.

P001812: gamyamānasya gamanaṃ kathaṃ nāmopapatsyate |gamyamānaṃ vigamanaṃ yadā naivopapadyate ||3||
P001813: 云何於去時 而當有去法若離於去法 去時不可得
P001815: How can going be possible within motion? Because motion that is not going is impossible.

P001812: gamyamānasya gamanaṃ yasya tasya prasajyate |ṛte gater gamyamānaṃ gamyamānaṃ hi gamyate ||4||
P001813: 若言去時去 是人則有咎離去有去時 去時獨去故
P001815: For whomever there is going within motion, for him it will follow that there could be no going within motion, because there is going within motion. (Or, following the structure and wording of v. 10: “To claim that there is going within motion implies that there could be no going within motion, because it is asserted there is going within motion.”)

P001812: gamyamānasya gamane prasaktaṃ gamanadvayam |yena tad gamyamānaṃ ca yac cātra gamanaṃ punaḥ ||5||
P001813: 若去時有去 則有二種去一謂為去時 二謂去時去
P001815: If there were going within motion, it would follow that going would be twofold: that by which one becomes someone in motion in a place and that by which one goes in that place.

P001812: dvau gantārau prasajyete prasakte gamanadvaye |gantāraṃ hi tiraskṛtya gamanaṃ nopapadyate ||6||
P001813: 若有二去法 則有二去者以離於去者 去法不可得
P001815: If going were twofold, the goer also would be twofold, because going is impossible without a goer.

P001812: gantāraṃ cet tiraskṛtya gamanaṃ nopapadyate |gamane ’sati gantātha kuta eva bhaviṣyati ||7||
P001813: 若離於去者 去法不可得以無去法故 何得有去者
P001815: If there were no goer, going would be impossible. If there were no going, where could a goer be existent?

P001812: gantā na gacchati tāvad agantā naiva gacchati |anyo gantur agantuś ca kas tṛtīyo ’tha gacchati ||8||
P001813: 去者則不去 不去者不去離去不去者 無第三去者
P001815: When a goer does not go, a non-goer cannot go; what third one other than a goer and a non-goer could go?

P001812: gantā tāvad gacchatīti katham evopapatsyate |gamanena vinā gantā yadā naivopapadyate ||9||
P001813: 若言去者去 云何有此義若離於去法 去者不可得
P001815: When a goer is impossible without going, then how is it possible to say: “a goer goes”?

P001812: pakṣo gantā gacchatīti yasya tasya prasajyate |gamanena vinā gantā gantur gamanam icchataḥ ||10||
P001813: 若去者有去 則有二種去一謂去者去 二謂去法去
P001815: To claim that a goer goes implies that there could be a goer who does not go, because it is asserted that a goer goes.

P001812: gamane dve prasajyete gantā yady uta gacchati |ganteti cājyate yena gantā san yac ca gacchati ||11||
P001813: 若謂去者去 是人則有咎離去有去者 說去者有去
P001815: If the goer goes, it would follow that going would be twofold: that which reveals* the goer and that which goes once he has become a goer.

P001812: gate nārabhyate gantuṃ gantuṃ nārabhyate ’gate |nārabhyate gamyamāne gantum ārabhyate kuha ||12||
P001813: 已去中無發 未去中無發去時中無發 何處當有發
P001815: If a beginning of going does not exist in what has gone, if a beginning of going does not exist also in what has not yet gone and if there does not exist a beginning within motion, wherein is a beginning of going made?

P001812: na pūrvaṃ gamanārambhād gamyamānaṃ na vā gatam |yatrārabhyeta gamanam agate gamanaṃ kutaḥ ||13||
P001813: 未發無去時 亦無有已去是二應有發 未去何有發
P001815: Before a beginning of going, there is not any motion or anything which has gone wherein going could begin. How can going exist in what has not yet gone?

P001812: gataṃ kiṃ gamyamānaṃ kim agataṃ kiṃ vikalpyate |adṛśyamāna ārambhe gamanasyaiva sarvathā ||14||
P001813: 無去無未去 亦復無去時一切無有發 何故而分別
P001815: If a beginning of going is simply not apparent in any way, examine: what has gone? what is motion? what has not yet gone?

P001812: gantā na tiṣṭhati tāvad agantā naiva tiṣṭhati |anyo gantur agantuś ca kas tṛtīyo ’tha tiṣṭhati ||15||

P001815: When a goer does not stay, a non-goer cannot stay; what third one other than a goer and a non-goer could stay?

P001812: gantā tāvat tiṣṭhatīti katham evopapatsyate |gamanena vinā gantā yadā naivopapadyate ||16||
P001813: 去者若當住 云何有此義若當離於去 去者不可得
P001815: When a goer is not possible without going, how then is it possible to say: “a goer stays.”

P001812: na tiṣṭhati gamyamānān na gatān nāgatād api |gamanaṃ saṃpravṛttiś ca nivṛttiś ca gateḥ samā ||17||
P001813: 去未去無住 去時亦無住所有行止法 皆同於去義
P001815: There is no reversal of motion*, nor also of what has gone and what has not yet gone. Reversal of going, engagement to stay and reversal of staying are similar to going.

P001815: It is inappropriate to say: “going and a goer are the same.” It is inappropriate to say: “going and a goer are different.”

P001812: yad eva gamanaṃ gantā sa eva hi bhaved yadi |ekībhāvaḥ prasajyeta kartuḥ karmaṇa eva ca ||19||

P001815: If whatever is going were a goer, it would follow that the actor and the act would be the same too.

P001815: If going and a goer were conceived as different, there could be going without a goer and a goer without going.

P001815: That very going by which a goer is made evident does not enable a goer to go. Because there is no goer before going, who would be going where?

P001815: A going which is other than the going by which a goer is made evident does not enable a goer to go. Because it is impossible for going to be twofold within a single goer.

P001815: One who is a goer does not go in the three aspects of going. Also one who is not a goer does not go in the three aspects of going.

P001813: 去法定不定 去者不用三是故去去者 所去處皆無
P001815: One who is and is not a goer also does not go in the three aspects of going. Therefore, going and a goer and also that which is gone over do not exist.

P001813: 離見不離見 見者不可得以無見者故 何有見可見
P001815: Without letting go of seeing a seer does not exist; in letting go of seeing, there is also no seer. If there is no seer, where can there be what-is-seen and seeing?

P001815: Just as it is said that a child emerges in dependence on a father and a mother, likewise it is said that consciousness emerges in dependence upon an eye and a visual form.

P001813: 見可見無故 識等四法無四取等諸緣 云何當得有
P001815: Because there is no what-is-seen and no seeing, the four such as consciousness do not exist. How can clinging etc. exist?

P001813: 耳鼻舌身意 聲及聞者等當知如是義 皆同於上說
P001815: It should be understood that seeing explains hearing and smelling and tasting and touching, mind, hearer, what is heard, etc.

P001815: Apart from the cause of form, form is not perceived. Apart from “form”, the cause of form also does not appear.

P001815: If there were form apart from the cause of form, it would follow that form is without cause; there is no object at all that is without cause.

P001812: rūpeṇa tu vinirmuktaṃ yadi syād rūpakāraṇam |akāryakaṃ kāraṇaṃ syād nāsty akāryaṃ ca kāraṇam ||3||

P001815: If a cause of form existed apart from form, it would exist as a cause without fruit; causes without fruit do not exist.

P001815: If form existed, a cause of form would be untenable; if form did not exist, a cause of form would be untenable.

P001812: niṣkāraṇaṃ punā rūpaṃ naiva naivopapadyate |tasmād rūpagatān kāṃścin na vikalpān vikalpayet ||5||
P001813: 無因而有色 是事終不然是故有智者 不應分別色
P001815: Forms which do not have a cause are not at all tenable. Therefore, do not conceive the concept of form at all.

P001812: na kāraṇasya sadṛśaṃ kāryam ity upapadyate |na kāraṇasyāsadṛśaṃ kāryam ity upapadyate ||6||
P001813: 若果似於因 是事則不然果若不似因 是事亦不然
P001815: It is untenable to say, “the fruit is like the cause.” It is also untenable to say, “the fruit is unlike the cause.”

P001812: vedanācittasaṃjñānāṃ saṃskārāṇāṃ ca sarvaśaḥ |sarveṣām eva bhāvānāṃ rūpeṇaiva samaḥ kramaḥ ||7||
P001813: 受陰及想陰 行陰識陰等其餘一切法 皆同於色陰
P001815: Feeling and perception, impulses and mind and all things are comparable in every aspect, at every stage with form.

P001812: vigrahe yaḥ parīhāraṃ kṛte śūnyatayā vadet |sarvaṃ tasyāparihṛtaṃ samaṃ sādhyena jāyate ||8||

P001815: When having argued by means of emptiness, everything of that one who objects is not an objection; it is similar to what is to be established .

P001812: vyākhyāne ya upālambhaṃ kṛte śūnyatayā vadet |sarvaṃ tasyānupālabdhaṃ samaṃ sādhyena jāyate ||9||

P001815: When having explained by means of emptiness, everything of that one who finds fault is not a fault; it is similar to what is to be established.

P001812: nākāśaṃ vidyate kiṃcit pūrvam ākāśalakṣaṇāt |alakṣaṇaṃ prasajyeta syāt pūrvaṃ yadi lakṣaṇāt ||1||
P001813: 空相未有時 則無虛空法若先有虛空 即為是無相
P001815: Not the slightest bit of space exists prior to the characteristics of space. If space existed prior to its characteristics, it would follow that it would be without characteristics.

P001812: alakṣaṇo na kaścic ca bhāvaḥ saṃvidyate kva cit |asaty alakṣaṇe bhāve kramatāṃ kuha lakṣaṇam ||2||
P001813: 是無相之法 一切處無有於無相法中 相則無所相
P001815: A thing without characteristics does not exist anywhere at all. If a thing without characteristics does not exist, to what do characteristics extend?

P001812: nālakṣaṇe lakṣaṇasya pravṛttir na salakṣaṇe |salakṣaṇālakṣaṇābhyāṃ nāpy anyatra pravartate ||3||
P001813: 有相無相中 相則無所住離有相無相 餘處亦不住
P001815: Characteristics do not extend to that which has no characteristics; nor to what possesses characteristics. They also cannot extend to something other than what either possesses or does not have characteristics.

P001812: lakṣaṇāsaṃpravṛttau ca na lakṣyam upapadyate |lakṣyasyānupapattau ca lakṣaṇasyāpy asaṃbhavaḥ ||4||
P001813: 相法無有故 可相法亦無可相法無故 相法亦復無
P001815: If characteristics do not extend to something, something characterized would be impossible. If something characterized is impossible, characteristics too would not exist.

P001812: tasmān na vidyate lakṣyaṃ lakṣaṇaṃ naiva vidyate |lakṣyalakṣaṇanirmukto naiva bhāvo ’pi vidyate ||5||
P001813: 是故今無相 亦無有可相離相可相已 更亦無有物
P001815: Therefore, something characterized does not exist and characteristics do not exist. There also does not exist a thing which is apart from being something characterized or a characteristic.

P001812: avidyamāne bhāve ca kasyābhāvo bhaviṣyati |bhāvābhāvavidharmā ca bhāvābhāvāv avaiti kaḥ ||6||
P001813: 若使無有有 云何當有無有無既已無 知有無者誰
P001815: If there is not a thing, of what can there be a non-thing? By whom are the opposites thing and non-thing known as a thing and a non-thing?

P001812: tasmān na bhāvo nābhāvo na lakṣyaṃ nāpi lakṣaṇam |ākāśam ākāśasamā dhātavaḥ pañca ye ’pare ||7||
P001813: 是故知虛空 非有亦非無非相非可相 餘五同虛空
P001815: Therefore, space is not a thing; it is not a non-thing; it is not something characterized; it is not a characteristic. The other five elements too are similar to space.

P001812: astitvaṃ ye tu paśyanti nāstitvaṃ cālpabuddhayaḥ |bhāvānāṃ te na paśyanti draṣṭavyopaśamaṃ śivam ||8||
P001813: 淺智見諸法 若有若無相是則不能見 滅見安隱法
P001815: Those of small minds see things as existent and non-existent. They do not behold the utter pacification of what is seen.

P001812: dhātuparīkṣā nāma pañcamaṃ prakaraṇaṃ ||
P001813: 中論觀六種品第五(八偈)
P001815: Investigation of the Elements

P001812: rāgād yadi bhavet pūrvaṃ rakto rāgatiraskṛtaḥ |taṃ pratītya bhaved rāgo rakte rāgo bhavet sati ||1||
P001813: 若離於染法 先自有染者因是染欲者 應生於染法
P001815: If a desirous one without desire exists before desire, desire would exist dependent on that desirous one. When a desirous one exists, desire exists.

P001812: rakte ’sati punā rāgaḥ kuta eva bhaviṣyati |sati vāsati vā rāge rakte ’py eṣa samaḥ kramaḥ ||2||
P001813: 若無有染者 云何當有染若有若無染 染者亦如是
P001815: If there were no desirous one, how could there be desire? The same follows for the desirous one too: it depends on whether desire exists or not.

P001812: sahaiva punar udbhūtir na yuktā rāgaraktayoḥ |bhavetāṃ rāgaraktau hi nirapekṣau parasparam ||3||
P001813: 染者及染法 俱成則不然染者染法俱 則無有相待
P001815: It is not reasonable for desire and the desirous one to arise as co-existent. In this way desire and the desirous one would not be mutually contingent.

P001812: naikatve sahabhāvo ’sti na tenaiva hi tat saha |pṛthaktve sahabhāvo ’tha kuta eva bhaviṣyati ||4||
P001813: 染者染法一 一法云何合染者染法異 異法云何合
P001815: Identity has no co-existence: something cannot be co-existent with itself. If there were difference, how could there be co-existence?

P001812: ekatve sahabhāvaś cet syāt sahāyaṃ vināpi saḥ |pṛthaktve sahabhāvaś cet syāt sahāyaṃ vināpi saḥ ||5||
P001813: 若一有合者 離伴應有合若異有合者 離伴亦應合
P001815: If the identical were co-existent, co-existence would also occur between the unrelated; if the different were co-existent, co-existence would also occur between the unrelated.

P001812: pṛthaktve sahabhāvaś ca yadi kiṃ rāgaraktayoḥ |siddhaḥ pṛthakpṛthagbhāvaḥ sahabhāvo yatas tayoḥ ||6||
P001813: 若異而有合 染染者何事是二相先異 然後說合相
P001815: If the different were co-existent, how would desire and the desirous one be established as different or, if that were so, how would those two be co-existent?

P001812: siddhaḥ pṛthakpṛthagbhāvo yadi vā rāgaraktayoḥ |sahabhāvaṃ kim artham tu parikalpayase tayoḥ ||7||
P001813: 若染及染者 先各成異相既已成異相 云何而言合
P001815: If desire and the desirous were established as different, because of what could one understand them as co-existent?

P001812: pṛthag na sidhyatīty evaṃ sahabhāvaṃ vikāṅkṣasi |sahabhāvaprasiddhyarthaṃ pṛthaktvaṃ bhūya icchasi ||8||
P001813: 異相無有成 是故汝欲合合相竟無成 而復說異相
P001815: If one asserts them to be co-existent because they are not established as different, then because they would be very much established as co-existent, would one not also have to assert them to be different?

P001812: pṛthagbhāvāprasiddheś ca sahabhāvo na sidhyati |katamasmin pṛthagbhāve sahabhāvaṃ satīcchasi ||9||
P001813: 異相不成故 合相則不成於何異相中 而欲說合相
P001815: Since different things are not established, co-existent things are not established. If there existed any different things, one could assert them as co-existent things.

P001812: evaṃ raktena rāgasya siddhir na saha nāsaha |rāgavat sarvadharmāṇāṃ siddhir na saha nāsaha ||10||
P001813: 如是染染者 非合不合成諸法亦如是 非合不合成
P001815: In that way, desire and the desirous one are not established as co-existent or not co-existent. Like desire, all phenomena are not established as co-existent or not co-existent.

P001812: rāgasaktiparīkṣā nāma ṣaṣṭaṃ prakaraṇaṃ ||
P001813: 中論觀染染者品第六(十偈)
P001815: Investigation of Desire and the Desirous One

P001812: yadi saṃskṛta utpādas tatra yuktā trilakṣaṇī |athāsaṃskṛta utpādaḥ kathaṃ saṃskṛtalakṣaṇam ||1||
P001813: 若生是有為 則應有三相若生是無為 何名有為相
P001815: If birth were compounded, it would possess the three characteristics of a compound. If birth were uncompounded, how would it be a characteristic of a compound?

P001812: utpādādyās trayo vyastā nālaṃ lakṣaṇakarmaṇi |saṃskṛtasya samastāḥ syur ekatra katham ekadā ||2||
P001813: 三相若聚散 不能有所相云何於一處 一時有三相
P001815: The three such as birth cannot individually be that which characterises compounds. How is it possible for one at one time to be compounded of all three?

P001812: utpādasthitibhaṅgānām anyat saṃskṛtalakṣaṇam |asti ced anavasthaivaṃ nāsti cet te na saṃskṛtāḥ ||3||
P001813: 若謂生住滅 更有有為相是即為無窮 無即非有為
P001815: If birth, abiding and perishing had an other characteristic of being compounded, this would be endless. If not, they would not be compounded.

P001812: utpādotpāda utpādo mūlotādasya kevalam |utpādotādam utpādo maulo janayate punaḥ ||4||
P001813: 生生之所生 生於彼本生本生之所生 還生於生生
P001815: The birth of birth gives birth to the root birth alone. The root birth also is that which gives birth to the birth of birth.

P001812: utpādotāda utpādo mūlotādasya te yadi |maulenājanitas taṃ te sa kathaṃ janayiṣyati ||5||
P001813: 若謂是生生 能生於本生生生從本生 何能生本生
P001815: If your birth of birth gives birth to the root birth, how does that which is not yet born from your root give birth to that root birth?

P001812: sa te maulena janito maulaṃ janayate yadi |maulaḥ sa tenājanitas tam utpādayate katham ||6||
P001813: 若謂是本生 能生於生生本生從彼生 何能生生生若生生生時 能生於本生生生尚未有 何能生本生
P001815: If that which is born from your root birth gives birth to the root, how does that root which is born from that give birth to that from which it is born?

P001812: ayam utpādyamānas te kāmam utpādayed imam |yadīmam utpādayitum ajātaḥ śaknuyād ayam ||7||
P001813: 若本生生時 能生於生生本生尚未有 何能生生生
P001815: If that which has not been born is able to give birth to that, that of yours which is being born should be able to give birth to that.

P001812: pradīpaḥ svaparātmānau saṃprakāśayate yathā |utpādaḥ svaparātmānāv ubhāv utpādayet tathā ||8||
P001813: 如燈能自照 亦能照於彼生法亦如是 自生亦生彼
P001815: Just as lamplight illuminates itself and others, likewise birth too gives birth to both itself and the thing of others.

P001812: pradīpe nāndhakāro ’sti yatra cāsau pratiṣṭhitaḥ |kiṃ prakāśayate dīpaḥ prakāśo hi tamovadhaḥ ||9||
P001813: 燈中自無闇 住處亦無闇破闇乃名照 無闇則無照
P001815: Wherever lamplight is present there is no darkness. What does lamplight illuminate? It illuminates by dispelling darkness.

P001812: katham utpadyamānena pradīpena tamo hatam |notadyamāno hi tamaḥ pradīpaḥ prāpnute yadā ||10||
P001813: 云何燈生時 而能破於闇此燈初生時 不能及於闇
P001815: If, when lamplight is being generated, it does not encounter darkness, how does the generation of lamplight dispel darkness?

P001812: aprāpyaiva pradīpena yadi vā nihataṃ tamaḥ |ihasthaḥ sarvalokasthaṃ sa tamo nihaniṣyati ||11||
P001813: 燈若未及闇 而能破闇者燈在於此間 則破一切闇
P001815: If darkness is dispelled even though it does not encounter lamplight, this lamplight dwelling here would eliminate the darkness that dwells in all the worlds.

P001812: pradīpaḥ svaparātmānau saṃprakāśayate yadi |tamo ’pi svaparātmānau chādayiṣyaty asaṃśayam ||12||
P001813: 若燈能自照 亦能照於彼闇亦應自闇 亦能闇於彼
P001815: If lamplight illuminated itself and the thing of others, darkness too would without doubt obscure itself and the thing of others.

P001812: anutpanno ’yam utpādaḥ svātmānaṃ janayet katham |athotanno janayate jāte kiṃ janyate punaḥ ||13||
P001813: 此生若未生 云何能自生若生已自生 生已何用生
P001815: How can unborn birth give birth to itself? If the born gives birth, when it has been born, what would be born?

P001812: notpadyamānaṃ notpannaṃ nānutpannaṃ kathaṃ cana |utpadyate tad ākhyātaṃ gamyamānagatāgataiḥ ||14||
P001813: 生非生已生 亦非未生生生時亦不生 去來中已答
P001815: The born and the unborn, the being born do not in any way give birth. That has been explained by the gone, not gone and going.

P001812: utpadyamānam utpattāv idaṃ na kramate yadā |katham utpadyamānaṃ tu pratītyotattim ucyate ||15||
P001813: 若謂生時生 是事已不成云何眾緣合 爾時而得生
P001815: When being born does not arise in what is born, then how can one say “it is being born in dependence on the born”?

P001812: pratītya yad yad bhavati tat tac chāntaṃ svabhāvataḥ |tasmād utpadyamānaṃ ca śāntam utpattir eva ca ||16||
P001813: 若法眾緣生 即是寂滅性是故生生時 是二俱寂滅
P001815: Whatever is dependently arising, that is by nature pacified. Therefore, being born and what is born too are pacified.

P001812: yadi kaścid anutpanno bhāvaḥ saṃvidyate kva cit |utpadyeta sa kiṃ tasmin bhāva utpadyate ’sati ||17||
P001813: 若有未生法 說言有生者此法先已有 更復何用生
P001815: If any unborn thing existed anywhere, on being born that unborn thing would not exist. If so, what would be born?

P001812: utpadyamānam utpādo yadi cotpādayaty ayam |utpādayet tam utpādam utpādaḥ katamaḥ punaḥ ||18||
P001813: 若言生時生 是能有所生何得更有生 而能生是生
P001815: If that which has been born gives birth to what is being born, what other thing that has been born would be giving birth to that which has been born?

P001812: anya utpādayaty enaṃ yady utpādo ’navasthitiḥ |athānutpāda utpannaḥ sarvam utpadyatāṃ tathā ||19||
P001813: 若謂更有生 生生則無窮離生生有生 法皆能自生
P001815: If another thing that has been born gives birth to it, this would be endless. If it is born without another which has been born OR if it is born without being born, everything would be born like that i.e. causelessly.

P001812: sataś ca tāvad utpattir asataś ca na yujyate |na sataś cāsataś ceti pūrvam evopapāditam ||20||
P001813: 有法不應生 無亦不應生有無亦不生 此義先已說
P001815: Thus it is not reasonable for what exists or does not exist to be born. It has been shown above that there is no existent or non-existent.

P001812: nirudhyamānasyotattir na bhāvasyopapadyate |yaś cānirudhyamānas tu sa bhāvo nopapadyate ||21||
P001813: 若諸法滅時 是時不應生法若不滅者 終無有是事
P001815: It is not tenable for a thing that is perishing to be born. It is not tenable for that which is not perishing to be a thing.

P001812: na sthitabhāvas_tiṣṭhaty_asthitabhāvo na tiṣṭhati |na tiṣṭhate tiṣṭhamānaḥ ko ’nutpannaś ca tiṣṭhati ||22||
P001813: 不住法不住 住法亦不住住時亦不住 無生云何住
P001815: A thing that has remained does not remain. A thing that has not yet remained does not remain. That which is remaining also does not remain. What unborn thing can remain?

P001812: sthitir nirudhyamānasya na bhāvasyopapadyate |yaś cānirudhyamānas tu sa bhāvo nopapadyate ||23||
P001813: 若諸法滅時 是則不應住法若不滅者 終無有是事
P001815: It is not possible for a thing that is perishing to remain. It is not possible for that which is not perishing to be a thing.

P001812: jarāmaraṇadharmeṣu sarvabhāveṣu sarvadā |tiṣṭhanti katame bhāvā ye jarāmaraṇaṃ vinā ||24||
P001813: 所有一切法 皆是老死相終不見有法 離老死有住
P001815: If all things at all times are aging and dying phenomena, what things are there which could remain without aging and dying?

P001812: sthityānyayā sthiteḥ sthānaṃ tayaiva ca na yujyate |utpādasya yathotpādo nātmanā na parātmanā ||25||
P001813: 住不自相住 亦不異相住如生不自生 亦不異相生
P001815: It is not reasonable for what remains to remain due to something else that remains or due to itself. This is like how what has been born is not given birth to by itself or another.

P001812: nirudhyate nāniruddhaṃ na niruddhaṃ nirudhyate |tathā nirudhyamānaṃ ca kim ajātaṃ nirudhyate ||26||
P001813: 法已滅不滅 未滅亦不滅滅時亦不滅 無生何有滅
P001815: What has ceased does not cease. What has not ceased also does not cease. Likewise what is ceasing also does not. What unborn thing can cease?

P001812: sthitasya tāvad bhāvasya nirodho nopapadyate |nāsthitasyāpi bhāvasya nirodha upapadyate ||27||
P001813: 法若有住者 是則不應滅法若不住者 是亦不應滅
P001815: It is not possible for a thing which has remained to cease. It is also not possible for a thing which has not remained to cease.

P001812: tayaivāvasthayāvasthā na hi saiva nirudhyate |anyayāvasthayāvasthā na cānyaiva nirudhyate ||28||
P001813: 是法於是時 不於是時滅是法於異時 不於異時滅
P001815: A particular state of something does not cause that particular state itself to cease. Moreover, another particular state does not cause that particular state to cease.

P001812: yadaiva sarvadharmāṇām utpādo nopapadyate |tadaivaṃ sarvadharmāṇāṃ nirodho nopapadyate ||29||
P001813: 如一切諸法 生相不可得以無生相故 即亦無滅相
P001815: When the birth of all phenomena is not possible, then the cessation of all phenomena is not possible.

P001812: sataś ca tāvad bhāvasya nirodho nopapadyate |ekatve na hi bhāvaś ca nābhāvaś copapadyate ||30||
P001813: 若法是有者 是即無有滅不應於一法 而有有無相
P001815: Cessation is not possible in an existent thing. Thingness and nothingness are not possible in one.

P001812: asato ’pi na bhāvasya nirodha upapadyate |na dvitīyasya śirasaś chedanaṃ vidyate yathā ||31||
P001813: 若法是無者 是即無有滅譬如第二頭 無故不可斷
P001815: Cessation is not possible also in what is not a thing. This is similar to how there is no cutting off a second head. i.e. a person cannot be beheaded twice

P001812: na svātmanā nirodho ’sti nirodho na parātmanā |utpādasya yathotādo nātmanā na parātmanā ||32||
P001813: 法不自相滅 他相亦不滅如自相不生 他相亦不生
P001815: Cessation does not exist by its own self, nor does cessation exist by something else. This is like how what has been born is not given birth to by itself or another

P001812: utpādasthitibhaṅgānām asiddher nāsti saṃskṛtam |saṃskṛtasyāprasiddhau ca kathaṃ setsyaty asaṃskṛtam ||33||
P001813: 生住滅不成 故無有有為有為法無故 何得有無為
P001815: Because birth and remaining and perishing are not established, there is no conditioned. Because the conditioned is utterly unestablished, how can the unconditioned be established?

P001812: yathā māyā yathā svapno gandharvanagaraṃ yathā |tathotpādas tathā sthānaṃ tathā bhaṅga udāhṛtam ||34||
P001813: 如幻亦如夢 如乾闥婆城所說生住滅 其相亦如是
P001815: Like a dream, like a magician’s illusion, like a city of gandharvas, likewise birth and likewise remaining, likewise perishing are taught.

P001812: saṃskṛtaparīkṣā nāma saptamaṃ prakaraṇaṃ ||
P001813: 觀三相品第七(三十五偈)
P001815: Investigation of Birth, Abiding and Perishing

P001812: sadbhūtaḥ kārakaḥ karma sadbhūtaṃ na karoty ayam |kārako nāpy asadbhūtaḥ karmāsadbhūtam īhate ||1||
P001813: 決定有作者 不作決定業決定無作者 不作無定業
P001815: One who exists as an actor does not do that which exists as an act. One who does not exist as an actor also does not do that which does not exist as an act.

P001812: sadbhūtasya kriyā nāsti karma ca syād akartṛkam |sadbhūtasya kriyā nāsti kartā ca syād akarmakaḥ ||2||
P001813: 決定業無作 是業無作者定作者無作 作者亦無業
P001815: One who exists has no activity; something would also exist as an act without an actor. One who exists has no activity; something would also exist as an actor without an act.

P001812: karoti yady asadbhūto ’sadbhūtaṃ karma kārakaḥ |ahetukaṃ bhavet karma kartā cāhetuko bhavet ||3||
P001813: 若定有作者 亦定有作業作者及作業 即墮於無因
P001815: If one who does not exist as an actor did that which does not exist as an act, the act would have no cause; the actor too would have no cause.

P001812: hetāv asati kāryaṃ ca kāraṇaṃ ca na vidyate |tadabhāve kriyā kartā kāraṇaṃ ca na vidyate ||4||
P001813: 若墮於無因 則無因無果無作無作者 無所用作法
P001815: If there were no cause, effect and cause would not be evident. If they were non-existent, activity and agent and doing would not be evident.

P001812: dharmādharmau na vidyete kriyādīnām asaṃbhave |dharme cāsaty adharme ca phalaṃ tajjaṃ na vidyate ||5||
P001813: 若無作等法 則無有罪福罪福等無故 罪福報亦無
P001815: If activity etc. did not appear, dharma and adharma would not be evident. If dharma and adharma did not exist, there would be no fruit that comes from them.

P001812: phale ’sati na mokṣāya na svargāyopapadyate |mārgaḥ sarvakriyāṇāṃ ca nairarthakyaṃ prasajyate ||6||
P001813: 若無罪福報 亦無有涅槃諸可有所作 皆空無有果
P001815: If there were no fruit, the path of liberation and higher states would not be appropriate. Also it would follow that all activities are meaningless.

P001812: kārakaḥ sadasadbhūtaḥ sadasat kurute na tat |parasparaviruddhaṃ hi sac cāsac caikataḥ kutaḥ ||7||
P001813: 作者定不定 不能作二業有無相違故 一處則無二
P001815: One who exists and does not exist as an actor does not do what exists and does not exist as an act. Since existence and non-existence are mutually contradictory in one thing, where can they exist?

P001812: satā ca kriyate nāsan nāsatā kriyate ca sat |kartrā sarve prasajyante doṣās tatra ta eva hi ||8||
P001815: One who exists as an actor does not do an act which is not existent. One who does not exist as an actor also does not do what exists as an act. Here too faults will follow for one.

P001812: nāsadbhūtaṃ na sadbhūtaḥ sadasadbhūtam eva vā |karoti kārakaḥ karma pūrvoktair eva hetubhiḥ ||9||
P001813: 有不能作無 無不能作有若有作作者 其過如先說
P001815: One who exists as an actor does not do what does not exist as an act and what neither exists or not as an act, because of what was demonstrated by the proof above.

P001812: nāsadbhūto ’pi sadbhūtaṃ sadasadbhūtam eva vā |karoti kārakaḥ karma pūrvoktair eva hetubhiḥ ||10||
P001813: 作者不作定 亦不作不定及定不定業 其過如先說
P001815: One who does not exist as an actor does not do what exists as an act and what neither exists or not as an act, because of what was demonstrated by the proof above.

P001812: karoti sadasadbhūto na san nāsac ca kārakaḥ |karma tat tu vijānīyāt pūrvoktair eva hetubhiḥ ||11||
P001813: 作者定不定 亦定亦不定不能作於業 其過如先說

P001813: 因業有作者 因作者有業成業義如是 更無有餘事
P001815: An actor depends on acts and acts too occur in dependence on an actor. Apart from this, one does not see a cause which is established.

P001812: evaṃ vidyād upādānaṃ vyutsargād iti karmaṇaḥ |kartuś ca karmakartṛbhyāṃ śeṣān bhāvān vibhāvayet ||13||

P001812: darśanaśravaṇādīni vedanādīni cāpy atha |bhavanti yasya prāg ebhyaḥ so ’stīty eke vadanty uta ||1||

P001815: Some say that whatever is involved in seeing, hearing etc. and feeling etc. exists prior to them.

P001812: vināpi darśanādīni yadi cāsau vyavasthitaḥ |amūny api bhaviṣyanti vinā tena na saṃśayaḥ ||4||

P001815: If it were present even without seeing etc., there would be no doubt that they would exist even without it.

P001812: ajyate kenacit kaścit kiṃcit kena cid ajyate |kutaḥ kiṃcid vinā kaścit kiṃcit kiṃcid vinā kutaḥ ||5||
P001813: 以法知有人 以人知有法離法何有人 離人何有法
P001815: It is illuminated by them; they are illuminated by it. How could it exist without them? How could they exist without it?

P001812: sarvebhyo darśanādibhyaḥ kaścit pūrvo na vidyate |ajyate darśanādinām anyena punar anyadā ||6||
P001813: 一切眼等根 實無有本住眼耳等諸根 異相而分別
P001815: It is not evident prior to the totality of seeing etc. From among seeing etc. a different one illuminates it at different times.

P001812: sarvebhyo darśanādibhyo yadi pūrvo na vidyate |ekaikasmāt kathaṃ pūrvo darśanādeḥ sa vidyate ||7||
P001813: 若眼等諸根 無有本住者眼等一一根 云何能知塵
P001815: If it is not evident prior to the totality of seeing etc., how can it be evident prior to each of them seeing etc. individually?

P001812: draṣṭā sa eva sa śrotā sa eva yadi vedakaḥ |ekaikasmād bhavet pūrvam evaṃ caitan na yujyate ||8||
P001813: 見者即聞者 聞者即受者如是等諸根 則應有本住
P001815: If the seer itself were the hearer and the feeler were it too, if it existed prior to each, in that way it would not make sense.

P001812: draṣṭānya eva śrotānyo vedako ’nyaḥ punar yadi |sati syād draṣṭari śrotā bahutvaṃ cātmanāṃ bhavet ||9||
P001813: 若見聞各異 受者亦各異見時亦應聞 如是則神多
P001815: If the seer were different, the hearer different, the feeler different, at the time the seer exists, there would be a hearer. Many selves would come about.

P001812: darśanaśravaṇādīni vedanādīni cāpy atha |bhavanti yebhyas teṣv eṣa bhūteṣv api na vidyate ||10||
P001813: 眼耳等諸根 苦樂等諸法所從生諸大 彼大亦無神
P001815: Also it is not evident in the elements from which seeing and hearing etc. and feeling etc. occur.

P001812: darśanaśravaṇādīni vedanādīni cāpy atha |na vidyate ced yasya sa na vidyanta imāny api ||11||
P001813: 若眼耳等根 苦樂等諸法無有本住者 眼等亦應無
P001815: If that to which seeing and hearing etc. and feeling etc. belong is not evident, they too could not be evident.

P001812: prāk ca yo darśanādibhyaḥ sāṃprataṃ cordhvam eva ca |na vidyate ’sti nāstīti nivṛttās tatra kalpanāḥ ||12||
P001813: 眼等無本住 今後亦復無以三世無故 無有無分別
P001815: Reject the concepts “it exists,” “it doesn’t exist” about that which is not evident prior to, now or after seeing etc.

P001812: yad indhanaṃ sa ced agnir ekatvaṃ kartṛkarmaṇoḥ |anyaś ced indhanād agnir indhanād apy ṛte bhavet ||1||
P001813: 若燃是可燃 作作者則一若燃異可燃 離可燃有燃
P001815: If firewood were fire, actor and act would be one. If fire were other than wood, it would occur even without wood.

P001812: nityapradīpta eva syād apradīpanahetukaḥ |punarārambhavaiyarthyam evaṃ cākarmakaḥ sati ||2||
P001813: 如是常應燃 不因可燃生則無燃火功 亦名無作火
P001815: Fire would burn permanently and would not arise from causes for burning. Starting a fire would be meaningless. If it were like that, there would also be no act.

P001812: paratra nirapekṣatvād apradīpanahetukaḥ |punarārambhavaiyarthyaṃ nityadīptaḥ prasajyate ||3||
P001813: 燃不待可燃 則不從緣生火若常燃者 人功則應空
P001815: Because fire does not depend on anything else, it would not arise from causes for burning. If it burned permanently, starting it would be meaningless.

P001812: tatraitat syād idhyamānam indhanaṃ bhavatīti cet |kenedhyatām indhanaṃ tat tāvanmātram idaṃ yadā ||4||

P001812: anyo na prāpsyate ’prapto na dhakṣyaty adahan punaḥ |na nirvāsyaty anirvāṇaḥ sthāsyate vā svaliṅgavān ||5||
P001813: 若異則不至 不至則不燒不燒則不滅 不滅則常住
P001815: Because fire is other, it would not connect; if it did not connect, it would not ignite; if it did not ignite, it would not die; if it did not die, it would also remain in possession of its own characteristic.

P001812: anya evendhanād agnir indhanaṃ prāpnuyād yadi |strī saṃprāpnoti puruṣaṃ puruṣaś ca striyaṃ yathā ||6||
P001813: 燃與可燃異 而能至可燃如此至彼人 彼人至此人
P001815: Just as a woman connects with a man and a man too with a woman, although fire is other than wood, it is fit to connect with wood.

P001812: anya evendhanād agnir indhanaṃ kāmam āpnuyāt |agnīndhane yadi syātām anyo’nyena tiraskṛte ||7||
P001813: 若謂燃可燃 二俱相離者如是燃則能 至於彼可燃
P001815: If fire and wood eliminated each other, even though fire is something other than wood, it would have to connect with wood.

P001812: yadīndhanam apekṣyāgnir apekṣyāgniṃ yadīndhanam |katarat pūrvaniṣpannaṃ yad apekṣyāgnir indhanam ||8||
P001813: 若因可燃燃 因燃有可燃先定有何法 而有燃可燃
P001815: If fire were dependent on wood and wood were dependent on fire, of what becomes fire and wood dependently, which would be established first?

P001812: yadīndhanam apekṣyāgnir agneḥ siddhasya sādhanam |evaṃ satīndhanaṃ cāpi bhaviṣyati niragnikam ||9||

P001815: If fire were dependent on wood, already established fire would be established again. Firewood also would be such even without fire.

P001812: yo ’pekṣya sidhyate bhāvas tam evāpekṣya sidhyati |yadi yo ’pekṣitavyaḥ sa sidhyatāṃ kam apekṣya kaḥ ||10||

P001815: If a thing (A) is established dependently (on B), but if what it depends upon (B) is established also in dependence on that very thing (A), what would be established in dependence on what?

P001812: yo ’pekṣya sidhyate bhāvaḥ so ’siddho ’pekṣate katham |athāpy apekṣate siddhas tv apekṣāsya na yujyate ||11||
P001813: 若法有待成 未成云何待若成已有待 成已何用待
P001815: How can a thing (A) which is established dependently (on B) be dependent (on B) when it (A) is not established? If one asks, “how can establishment be dependent?” It is not reasonable for it (A) to be dependent.

P001812: apekṣyendhanam agnir na nānapekṣyāgnir indhanam |apekṣyendhanam agniṃ na nānapekṣyāgnim indhanam ||12||
P001813: 因可燃無燃 不因亦無燃因燃無可燃 不因無可燃
P001815: There is no fire that is dependent on wood; there is also no fire that is not dependent on wood. There is no wood that is dependent on fire; there is also no wood that is not dependent on fire.

P001812: āgacchaty anyato nāgnir indhane ’gnir na vidyate |atrendhane śeṣam uktaṃ gamyamānagatāgataiḥ ||13||

P001815: Fire does not come from something else; fire also does not exist in wood. Likewise, the remainder of wood has been shown by gone, not-gone and going.

P001812: indhanaṃ punar agnir na nāgnir anyatra cendhanāt |nāgnir indhanavān nāgnāv indhanāni na teṣu saḥ ||14||
P001813: 可燃即非然 離可燃無燃燃無有可燃 燃中無可燃
P001815: Wood itself is not fire; fire is also not something other than wood. Fire does not possess wood; wood does not exist in fire; that (fire) does not exist in it.

P001812: agnīndhanābhyāṃ vyākhyāta ātma-upādānayoḥ kramaḥ |sarvo niravaśeṣeṇa sārdhaṃ ghaṭapaṭādibhiḥ ||15||
P001813: 以燃可燃法 說受受者法及以說瓶衣 一切等諸法
P001815: Through fire and wood is explained without exception all the stages of self and the grasped and at the same time jugs, cloth and so on.

P001812: ātmanaś ca satattvaṃ ye bhāvānāṃ ca pṛthak pṛthak |nirdiśanti na tān manye śāsanasyārthakovidān ||16||
P001813: 若人說有我 諸法各異相當知如是人 不得佛法味
P001815: I do not think those who teach the identity or difference of self and things are wise in the meaning of the teaching.

P001815: For that without beginning and end, where can a middle be in that? Therefore, it is not possible for it to have before, after, and simultaneous phases.

P001812: kāryaṃ ca kāraṇaṃ caiva lakṣyaṃ lakṣaṇam eva ca |vedanā vedakaś caiva santy arthā ye ca ke cana ||7||
P001813: 諸所有因果 相及可相法受及受者等 所有一切法
P001815: It is not just samsara alone that has no before-extreme, cause and fruit themselves, and characteristics and the basis for characteristics themselves,

P001812: pūrvā na vidyate koṭiḥ saṃsārasya na kevalam |sarveṣām api bhāvānāṃ pūrvā koṭī na vidyate ||8||
P001813: 非但於生死 本際不可得如是一切法 本際皆亦無
P001815: feeling and the feeler, whatever is suitable to bear meaning, also all things have no before-extreme.

P001812: svayaṃ kṛtaṃ parakṛtaṃ dvābhyāṃ kṛtam ahetukam |duḥkham ity eka icchanti tac ca kāryaṃ na yujyate ||1||

P001815: If anguish arose from another person, who would that other person be who, having made it, gives it to someone else, but is not included in the anguish?

P001812: svayaṃ kṛtasyāprasiddher duḥkhaṃ parakṛtaṃ kutaḥ |paro hi duḥkhaṃ yat kuryāt tat tasya syāt svayaṃ kṛtam ||7||
P001813: 自作若不成 云何彼作苦若彼人作苦 即亦名自作

P001812: na tāvat svakṛtaṃ duḥkhaṃ na hi tenaiva tat kṛtam |paro nātmakṛtaś cet syād duḥkhaṃ parakṛtaṃ katham ||8||
P001813: 苦不名自作 法不自作法彼無有自體 何有彼作苦

P001812: syād ubhābhyāṃ kṛtaṃ duḥkhaṃ syād ekaikakṛtaṃ yadi |parākārāsvayaṃkāraṃ duḥkham ahetukaṃ kutaḥ ||9||

P001813: 諸法有異故 知皆是無性無性法亦無 一切法空故
P001815: Things have no essential nature because they are seen to change into something else. Things do not lack an essential nature because things are emptiness.

P001814: ༎ གང་གིས་ཐུགས་བརྩེ་ཉེར་བཟུང་ནས་། ། ལྟ་བ་ཐམས་ཅད་སྤང་བའི་ཕྱིར་། །དམ་པའི་ཆོས་ནི་སྟོན་མཛད་པ་། ། གོཨོ་ཏམ་དེ་ལ་ཕྱག་འཚལ་ལོ་༎༼༡༩ཨ༡༽༎ དབུ་མ་རྩ་བའི་ཚིག་ལེའུར་བྱས་པ་ཤེས་རབ་ཅེས་བྱ་བ་ཐེག་པ་ཆེན་པོའི་ཆོས་མངོན་པ་རྣམ་པར་གཞག་པ་། ། དོན་དམ་པའི་དེ་ཁོ་ན་ཡང་དག་པར་སྟོན་པ་། ཤེས་རབ་ཀྱི་ཕ་རོལ་ཏུ་ཕྱིན་པའི་ཚུལ་གསལ་བར་བྱེད་པ་། སློབ ༼༢༽དཔོན་བདག་ཉིད་ཆེན་པོ་འཕགས་པ་ཀླུ་སྒྲུབ་མི་འཕྲོགས་པའི་མཁྱེན་རབ་དང་ཐུགས་རྗེར་ལྡན་པ་། དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པའི་ཐེག་པ་བླ་ན་མེད་པའི་ཚུལ་གསལ་བར་བྱེད་པ་། རབ་ཏུ་དགའ་བའི་ས་བསྒྲུབས་ནས་། བདེ་བ་ཅན་གྱི་ཞིང་དུ་གཤེགས ༼༣༽པ་། འཇིག་རྟེན་གྱི་ཁམས་དང་བའི་འོད་ཅེས་བྱ་བར་། དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་ཡེ་ཤེས་འབྱུང་གནས་འོད་ཅེས་བྱ་བར་འགྱུར་བས་མཛད་པ་རྫོགས་སོ་༎ ༎ དབང་ཕྱུག་དམ་པའི་མངའ་བདག་རྒྱལ་པོ་ཆེན་པོ་དཔལ་ལྷ་བཙན་པོའི་བཀའ་ལུང་གིས་། ༼༤༽རྒྱ་གར་གྱི་མཁན་པོ་ཆེན་པོ་དབུ་མ་པ་། ཛཉའ་ན་གརབྷ་དང་། ཞུ་ཆེན་གྱི་ལོ་ཙཚ་བ་དགེ་སློང་ཅོག་རོ་ཀླུའི་རྒྱལ་མཚན་གྱིས་བསྒྱུར་ཅིང་ཞུས་ཏེ་གཏན་ལ་ཕབ་པ་། འདི་ལ་རབ་ཏུ་བྱེད་པ་ཉི་ཤུ་རྩ་བདུན་། ། ཤློཨོ་ཀ་བཞི་བརྒྱ་བཞི་བཅུ་རྩ་དགུ་ཡོད་། བམ་པོ་ནི་ཕྱེད་དང ༼༥༽གཉིས་སུ་བྱས་སོ་། ། སླད་ཀྱིས་ཁ་ཆེའི་གྲོང་ཁྱེར་དཔེ་མེད་ཀྱི་དབུས་། གཙུག་ལག་ཁང་རིན་ཆེན་སྦས་པའི་དབུས་སུ་། ཁ་ཆེའི་མཁན་པོ་ཧ་སུ་མ་ཏི་དང་། བོད་ཀྱི་སྒྲ་བསྒྱུར་གྱི་ལོ་ཙཚ་བ་པ་ཚབ་ཉི་མ་གྲགས་ཀྱིས་མིའི་བདག་པོ་འཕགས་པ་ལྷའི་སྐུ་རིང་ལ ༼༦༽འགྲེལ་པ་ཚིག་གསལ་བ་དང་བསྟུན་ནས་བཅོས་པའོ་༎ ༎ སླད་ཀྱིས་ར་ས་འཕྲུལ་སྣང་གི་གཙུག་ལག་ཁང་དུ་། རྒྱ་གར་གྱི་མཁན་པོ་ཀ་ན་ཀ་དང་། ལོ་ཙཚ་བ་དེ་ཉིད་ཀྱིས་ཞུ་ཆེན་བགྱིས་པའོ་༎
